nodes.bodyText: Maybe, it would be better to make these values configurable too

I rewrite that has been. In CopybookStorable we had this:
  private static final long TTU = 3600000L * 3L;

This means hardcoded 3 hours after writing to the cache. I've decided to change it to 3 hours after the last access.
I agree that we could make this value configurable. Do you think that we need this configurable value in hours or minutes? In case when retention policy will be half an hour.

I think that 3 hours after writing is ok. We may either provide the time unit as a configuration or use hardcoded seconds or milliseconds and provide only the value.
Due to it is not something that we are going to change rarely, I would prefer the second option.
Since we're planning here to do refactor here I think could be nice to move those config in a property file in order to have a better customization for future needs

All right. I will make duration and time unit configurable but initialize them as we do for cache-max-size already.
I agree, that having a separate property file will be a good option. I'll do it in a separate PR.
Shouldn't we copy the object? Or it is assured by the Cache?

We don't need to copy an object in the current implementation. The thing is that CopybookStorable is modifiable, and maybe that why the object is copied before storing. But current implementation uses CopybookModel which is unmodifiable, it is safe to use one instance everywhere.
I think you may extract this builder and reuse the code for both constructors
I'm not sure that now it is better.
I think is more safety to use Math.toIntExact(cache.size())
Yes, it will be safe. Didn't know about this one.
can we safely reuse the instance of CopybookModel instead to create a new one?
Oops, my fault, I was planned to use the same copybookModel instance.
I think we may get rid of the "dummy stuff" loaded in this provider, I saw that in some test we create an instance of CopybookModel directly though its constuctor
Question - not sure: can we use Duration.ofHours(3).toNanos()?
